Reviews.Title: “very good location, good budget choice.”
Reviews.Author: consultantphil
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is down a quiet Calle, about 100 mtrs from Ferrovia railway stn and Ferrovia waterbus stop. If all you NEED - note the word - need, is a smallish room, smallish bathroom, clean and tidy, basic breakfast to get you kick-started, then this is FINE. NO noise at night, REALLY close to shops, cafes, etc, I found the staff friendly and helpful. It is NOT vast and pretentious, and space is at a premium, but you get what you pay for. My EIGHTH visit to Venice for Carnevale 2012, took an old mate and his lady and they were happy enough. Our rooms were adequate, warm ever this time of year Feb 17th - 21st, and the beds comfortable. Cleaning is fine. You need BIGGER or BETTER, easy! Just pay a lot more somewhere else. Me? I use it to sleep, wash and dress then I am out and about!! Going to Venice on a tight budget, well you could easily spend more and get a whole lot less. I HEREBY CERTIFY that this is an honest and complete review with no thoughts of a quid-pro-quo.

Reviews.Title: “Decent room but I'll reconsider”
Reviews.Author: starshar
Reviews.Content: Accomodations in Venice are not cheap. For the price we paid, 55eur, we kinda expect the quality of the room. But the location is superb, about 3-5mins walk away from Venezia SL station. Map is provided. You have to check-in at their sister's hotel, which is located 50m away. And from there, a lady brought us to Hotel Atlantide, which is situated about 20m in the alley. Decent room I would say. There's even a couch which was a plus point. We were looking around for the remote control, only to find out from the lady that we had to get it from the check-in place. Deposit 10eur which will be returned when you check out. One thing that bothers us is the smell coming out from the toilet during the night. It smelt so horrible like the drainage system was damaged or something?

Reviews.Title: “shambles”
Reviews.Author: ronniemonnie
Reviews.Content: we were treated to a tiny (and i mean tiny) room with a tv that didn't work, a shower that had 2 drops of warm water and wall paper that was peeling off the walls. the staff didn't care when we explained suddenly not speaking very good english and making some feeble excuses. the only thing this hotel has going for it is its proximity to the train and ferry services.

Reviews.Title: “False pictures on their website!”
Reviews.Author: QuebecIrish
Reviews.Content: Unclean, dark humid rooms with crappy beds. Front desk clerk looks down on customers. This place must be a last resort choice! Better off staying out of town and paying cabs in and out. Barely a 1/2 star

Reviews.Title: “Great location and Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: bosmanger
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Atlantide for two nights and I was very pleased with the hotel. It was about a five minute walk from the train station which was convenient. The gentleman at the front desk spoke english very well and was helpful in explaining the sights to see, the do's and don'ts of venice and italy (giving money to beggars, etc.) I would recommend this hotel to backpackers and visitors who are more interested in seeing the city of Venice rather than a luxurious hotel room, and people with a budget. Fantastic value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Go to this hotel if it's the only option left!”
Reviews.Author: InfernoFS
Reviews.Content: Let me put everything in bullets for you readers: - Wallpaper was ripped and hanging of the walls - No curtains, which is pretty lame when your in a room with a window facing east. When the sun rose, you are awake. During summertime that's way to early... - The door of the only closet was busted. - The room smelled like it had not been opened for 5 years. - The temperature was terrible (way too hot). - Lousy breakfast. - Inaccessible balcony with broken balustrade. - TV the only show snow. - No pressure in the shower with hardly any ability to regulate the temperature. The only benefit this hotel has, is the proximity of the train station. Go to this hotel if it's the only option left!

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended”
Reviews.Author: sunflower711
Reviews.Content: We booked a room through their website, expecting our room to look like the photos we saw there. Not even close!!! It was awful, old and run down, smelled bad, loud, tiny room. The only plus they have is that they're located next to the train station...so it's easy to leave! We left early and went somewhere else. The free breakfast is not worth it either.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: KshitijG
Reviews.Content: No heating. Has no lift. Staff very rude. No help at all. Rooms n bathrooms small like a matchbox. Avoid at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel for short stay”
Reviews.Author: GodisPyry
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very well located near the train station, about 5min walk. When we needed to check out, we could leave our stuff at the hotel and pick them when we were leaving. That was nice. Near the hotel there were many little shops to buy food and drinks, so it didn't matter that the breakfast wasn't included. Prices weren't too bad either. The room itself was pretty clean, only problem was some mould on the cealing. You could really smell it in the washroom. But it wasn't bothering, because we didn't spend too much time in the room anyways. Also, there were some moskitos flying around and during the night the room got pretty cold. Luckily I got longsleeve pants and shirt with me! I also red somewhere that moskitos and coldness is usual in Venice, so I don't think it only means this place. For one night stay the room was good, considering the cheap price for the room.

Reviews.Title: “Good price, location and staff, RECOMENDED”
Reviews.Author: todoviaje28
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 2 nights, it is very well located, the room was clean, on the 4th floor with no lift but it is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad After Making Some Adjustments”
Reviews.Author: timman19
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for six nights on a package deal purchased through Expedia. This is your typical small and privately owned European hotel of which many are to be found in Venice. Location: This is one of the stronger points of this hotel. Itâ€™s a short walk from either the train station, bus station at Piazzale Roma or from the water bus stop. Itâ€™s not far from the Grand Canal and has excellent access to local shopping and restaurants. If you come from the airport, take the ATVO bus to Piazzale Roma and then walk across the bridge. The bus costs 3 Euros per person and is much better than the public bus that runs the same route. Itâ€™s a 10 minute walk from the bus stop to reach the hotel and its much cheaper than a water taxi from the airport. The hotel is off the main streets so it was quiet in that area at night. We heard very little noise from either outside or inside the hotel. Check-in: We greeted by a friendly front desk person. Our room was already assigned. There are no elevators or lifts to be found so you will have to haul your luggage up the stairs. We were on the second floor so that was manageable. The staff will assist with luggage if you request it. Room: Small but typical of a European hotel and especially in Venice. It was actually larger than I expected after seeing the rooms on the hotelâ€™s website. It didnâ€™t have any strange smells but it could have used a good cleaning. The ceramic tile floor was very dirty as were the curtains which were full of dead mosquitoes. It seemed as though the housekeeping staff just makes the bed, wipes down the bathroom and takes out the garbage. We had a double bed which was two single beds pushed together. It was comfortable so no problems there. The bathroom was small but well designed. The shower was small and the water pressure fine. The problem was the water temperature. There was no way to control it and keep it at a steady and comfortable temperature. It would be boiling hot one moment which forced us to make it colder. That worked for a little while but then it would turn freezing cold which forced us to make it hotter again. The solution was to turn the water off after getting wet and than lathering up and then rinsing off. That worked better for us. Make sure you leave the bathroom door open when you leave the room as there is no other ventilation other than doing that. There was a small air conditioner in the room. This didnâ€™t work all that well. I set it to the lowest possible setting and this set off a trickle of cool air into our room. The good part was that it did go towards the bed but still wasnâ€™t a total relief. On our first night, we tried to counter this by opening the window. That backfired as were literally attacked by mosquitoes in the night. The next night, we tried sleeping with repellant but that wasnâ€™t very comfortable due to the smell of that. Provided that the housekeeping staff didnâ€™t turn the air conditioner off, the room was somewhat comfortable when we got back in the evening. We managed and adjusted by stopping at the room in the mid-afternoon to make sure the air was on in the room. This way it was somewhat comfortable when we got back in the evening. We had a small television that didnâ€™t work. We asked the front desk who said that they would check it but it never was repaired. It only shows local Italian television anyway so we didnâ€™t miss much. Staff: Overall they were pretty friendly and helpful. My wifeâ€™s luggage did not make our connecting flight to Venice. It was delivered to the hotel the next day and the staff kept an eye out for it while we were out for the day. We were in our room when it arrived and they brought it right upstairs to us. Make sure you give them your room key when leaving the hotel. We did not know this until our second day and got a bit of a friendly lecture from them. This is how they keep track of if you are in the hotel or not. The key is attached to a very heavy key chain so you wonâ€™t want to carry that around anyway. The front door is closed and locked between 2:00 a.m. and 5:00 a.m. so you wonâ€™t be able to get into the hotel during those hours. The staff speaks at least decent English. There is an apparent rift between the front desk staff and the housekeeping staff as we saw them arguing quite often near the lobby. Breakfast: We didnâ€™t qualify for it as we had a room only reservation. This was fine as we heard from other guests that it wasnâ€™t that great. Finding a place to eat was not a problem in that part of town. The breakfast room itself is small and there may be a wait when you get there. Other comments: The building, like the rest of Venice, is very old. This hotel is showing a lot of wear and tear. There were numerous scratches and nicks in the walls. The common areas and hallways really needed a good cleaning and perhaps a coat of paint wouldnâ€™t hurt either. This is a basic, no frills hotel. There are not many amenities to be found here. I did find a small vending machine that sold water, beer and sodas. That was all. Overall, not a bad stay. The location canâ€™t be beat and the adjustments we made to the issues we encountered made our stay better. Considering how much we paid, I am not going to complain about too much. Since we were in one of the most beautiful cities in the world, we didnâ€™t spend much time here other than to sleep and shower. I suggest everyone else who stays here does the same! The price is good and if you are looking for a place to stay without breaking the bank, this is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad...”
Reviews.Author: El-Yuca-Ingles
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night here; excellent welcome from friendly receptionist when we arrived late morning; although the room was not ready she let us leave our stuff, and we went out to explore. The room was tired, but clean, and the bathroom was fine. We did not encounter any bugs! The AC did not work very well, but it was not particularly hot the day we were there. We had the guests from hell across the hall, who spent the whole night going in and out of their room and slamming the door. Apart from them, it was a good stay!

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: fanofitalyCa
Reviews.Content: Pros: Close to train station, vaparetto stop, short walk to Piazza S.Marco. Inexpensive. Surprisingly clean bathroom & relatively spacious. Perfect for short stay in Venice. free breakfast. Friendly staff Cons: extremely small room, nothing fancy. not good for family with kids. This is not the by the Grand Canal romantic hotel, but a value for money, clean, basic, adequate, perfect for short stay hotel. You could pay much more for only marginally better hotels in Venice. My husband & I spent 1 night in Venice & this is extremely convenient for getting in & out of Venice via train. Short walk from the train station.

Reviews.Title: “don't expect to much but localization is great”
Reviews.Author: przyplyw
Reviews.Content: This is a bugdet hotel, so don't expect to much. Room was large - one double bed + sofa, the air condition didn't work but we've got a electric ventilator and it was fine. The bathroom was clean and nice. Location is very good, around 20 min walk to the Rialto Bridge, 3 min to the train and ferries station. You will get the simply breakfast as well. I think that holet is one of the cheapest one in the great Old Venice, that's why I recommended it for my friend!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Mrukk
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the perfect choice for us. It was very handy to the train station, so it was really easy to just drop our bags off and get going on our Venice adventures. The price we got was leagues better than anything else in Venice, and we really didn't find anything that made it obvious why. The staff were ok, the room was smallish but quite adequate, and the bathroom was good. It was great to have air conditioning. The breakfast in the morning wasn't the best in the world, but it was fine. We really couldn't complain for the price. Overall, we were thrilled by this place... nothing was overwhelmingly wrong about it (in fact we found it reasonably nice), and it meant that we just had that much more money to spend on more important things!

Reviews.Title: “Best location for tourists and short stays”
Reviews.Author: Nibnib
Reviews.Content: The location was brilliant for what I wanted. It is 5mins walk from the train station and very close to the main tourist shopping drag. I found the room adequate, quiet and clean, but the bathroom was a bit cramped. Didn't try the breakfast as we were early risers.

Reviews.Title: “A Character Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cs42
Reviews.Content: This hotel provides a good deal for the traveller that wants an Italian experience in a convenient location near the station, and main waterbus routes. We would stay again. Staff are chatty and speak good English, but are under pressure at breakfast times. If you bear with them you will be rewarded with a good breakfast (we had apples, eggs, cherries, croissant, chocolate cake, cereal, fresh coffee). If you recognise that one man has to serve breakfast to a full 27 room hotel in a short space of time, and are patient, enjoy the singing and chat to the staff, you will enjoy your stay. If you have a strict time schedule, and expect an instant table and prompt service, you will be disappointed. The hotel rooms are clean and have character, but rooms are Venetian (dark and gloomy). Our en suite was well equipped and modern. The TV provided in our room was tiny and old and Italian channels only. Lots of nearby restaurants, some very cheap (1 euro for a coffee). Was attacked by mosquitos, don't know if Venice is always bad for mosquitos in June.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: Cistine
Reviews.Content: My room is very small and there is no shutters for the window. Sunlight comes in early in the morning and my quality of sleep is bad. The breakfast room is also tiny and can accommodate 12 persons one at a time. We have to queue up and wait. Terrible again. Hotel management does not care my frustrations and does nothing to make some changes for me. If anyone intend to spend your holiday in this hotel, pls do reconsider.

Reviews.Title: “great location and the price was right”
Reviews.Author: illinicheme
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Atlantide on a Saturday and Sunday night in late March. Pros: - Great location. I prefer to haul luggage a short distance from train station to hotel and then travel farther to the sights if need be. This hotel absolutely fits that bill. It was close, easy to find, and no hauling of bags around on the water buses was required. - Clean. - Price. Couldn't beat 92 euros for two nights. - Reasonably quiet (no budget hotels in Europe are going to be truly quiet, but this hotel gave a silent night sleep compared to the places we stayed in Rome, Florence, and Milan on the same trip). - Decent breakfast (fresh juice, selection of breads, nutella, fresh grapes, hard-boiled eggs - easily the best "breakfast included" meal we had in Italy). - Private bathroom. Not something that is always included at this per night price. Cons: - Price was right because our double was an "economy" room - i.e. bunk beds. And the room was incredibly small - even by budget European hotel standards. It was not possible to have a suitcase open and be moving between the bed and the bathroom. - No good heat control. The radiators were apparently on timers, leaving us no control over the temperature in the room. Overall it wasn't bad, but it was usually slightly too hot or slightly too cold. (Quite stuffy when the radiators came on from 2am-5am or so.) - No elevator. Not uncommon in European budget hotels, but if you can't carry your suitcase up four flights of stairs, this is not the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly pleasant”
Reviews.Author: andujhar
Reviews.Content: We booked the Atlantide because the price was about the lowest we could find actually in Venice and the hotel is very close to the train station which is great. When we showed up, we actually stayed in another hotel owned by the same family/group(?). The front desk seems to manages three different "hotels" which are all right next to each other so we did not technically stay in the Atlantide, but this is where we booked. The staff were nice. The breakfast---which is in the central front desk hotel and is shared by all three hotels---was surprisingly very good and filling (it included eggs, fruit, coffee, and bread and was included in the price of our stay). The place was clean and quiet and we didn't find the room too cramped; the bathroom even had towel warmers, which was nice (in January). I'd stay in this hotel again...

Reviews.Title: “Very good for the money we paid”
Reviews.Author: igorp
Reviews.Content: Located five minites on foot from the train station. Rooms are very small but clean. People are very friendly. Breakfast was nice. Good value hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Better Expected!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Tanichka
Reviews.Content: Better than Expected!! the hotel is very basic hotel, but not bad at all/// very close to train station. we actually walked with out laggage for about 5 minutes. The room was small, but clean. Bathroom was very clean and new with this new fansy shower. The breakfast was fine.. but served in very small room. so some people had tp wait for others to finish. I think you can also go to sister hotel near by to have breakfast. The staff spoke english and was very helpful. there was girl -- he asked her to show us nice places to eat.. she tried her best english and was very helpful..We had very early flight ..and staff gave us coffee and crossons ..very nice of them.. YOU can walk to Realto Bridge in about 15 minutes or even to st.Mark square..in 20-25 minutes from hotel. If you need to take bus to airport.. you will have to walk to Roma piazza. about 10 minutes from hotel.. Not BAD// I think that hotel is exellent value for money.. i would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Budget and very basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Leroy_C
Reviews.Content: I guess you pay for what you get. Hotel is up a very narrow dark alley way but is very close to the Santa Lucia railway station and on the main Venice island. Hotel is extremely basic and breakfast room is too small for the amount of guests. You may be asked to take breakfast in a neighbouring hotel (part of the same chain). We had a top floor room which had plastic doors and just didn't look secure. Baggage was left with Reception, but not put in a secure location, everyones baggage is simply left in the lobby corridoor. There is no English speaking T.V. (no CNN / BBC World) But you don't come to Venice to watch TV! Room decor is extremelly dated we had patches of missing wallpaper and it was also peeling off in other places. Less than 5 minutes walk from train station and Vaporetto station. (Water busses). Most places are walkable, 20 minutes to Rialto and 25 / 30 minutes to St Marks. Stay here if location and budget are your only concerns. Check the hotel website, this was cheaper than any price we found with any other website. Room payment was cash only on arrival.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: BeijingtoVenice
Reviews.Content: I've been a dozen times to Venice, but i've never felt soo good as at Hotel Atlantide. The hotel is really simple and clean, and the staff is kind and friendly. The location has no comparisons. It takes less than 3 minutes walking from the train station, without crossing any bridge, in a very quiet calle but just 20 metres from a central street full of shops and restaurants. The rooms are small compared to any hotel in any other italian city, but remember you're in Venice, a city set in an artificial environment created by human hands on the sea, so for a two stars it's absolutely reasonable. The room decorations are basic, but the toilet seemed brand new. The breakfast is served in a very small room, but you can sit outside in sunny days, which is really enjoyable. The buffet includes, among the usual stuff, very fresh and good milk and tasty scrumbled eggs (cooked at the moment, which is not usual in 2 stars). Once it was really crowded, and i was taken to a nearby twin hotel, in a beautiful palace . The staff was always in a good mood and gave me plenty of good advices.. usually in crowded cities as Venice they don't have much time for guests, thet rather address you directly to queue at the local touristic office. In conclusion: the location and the warm welcoming atmosphere of the Hotel Atlantide makes it my most favorite for my next stay in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “good value two star hotel”
Reviews.Author: annii
Reviews.Content: Just returned from three night stay in this two star hotel ~ rooms are basic but clean en-suite showers are small but acceptable - towels changed daily - rooms cleaned daily etc. staff were very friendly and helpful. If considering this hotel bear in mind it is mostly young students who can be noisy so if this is a problem book elsewhere. Very good location close to the station and vaporetto stop. Good selection of shops and restaurants practically on the doorstep.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Atlantide
HotelInfo.Address: Cannaregio375 / A | Cannaregio, 30121 Venice, Italy
